User Interface¶

Generating UI¶

Generating the UI is handled by the generate_ui module.

The UI is sorted into several tabs. Each tab groups multiple SPN’s together, usually by similar type. (DIG I/P, PWM O/P, VOLTAGE…)

Each Tab contains a number of labels, buttons, dropdown menus, and text boxes.

This module contains functions that handle the creation of widgets, and their placement within the UI.

Updating UI¶

Once the UI is generated and the components initialized, a thread handles any updates and changes made to the widgets listed.

class UserInterface.update_ui.update_ui(ob1, ob2)¶
mainloop()¶

Holds Tkinter .mainloop()

Main function for running UI.

DO NOT REMOVE

update_cpu()¶

Displays CPU usage under Settings tab

Uses ‘psutil’

update_settings()¶

Updates Color Of Settings Buttons depending on their linked value.

update_ui_offline()¶

Part of ui_update thread.

Checks to see if any boards are offline. If so, linked UI widgets will be disabled.

update_ui_spn()¶

Function to update UI based on dictionary data.

Tied to First 7 SPN Tabs.

This is what causes the buttons to flash red and green in testing mode.

UI Callbacks¶

These functions are meant to be callbacks that are ran when the corresponding widget is activated.
